Hoover Institution Archives

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, reports, and memoranda, relating to Russian refugees in Yugoslavia after the Russian Revolution and Civil War and the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary for the Settlement of Russian Refugees in Yugoslavia

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sergeĭ Nikolaevich Paleolog papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1934.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Chairman, Board of the Government Plenipotentiary for the Settlement of Russian Refugees in Yugoslavia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, reports, and memoranda, relating to Russian refugees in Yugoslavia after the Russian Revolution and Civil War and the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary for the Settlement of Russian Refugees in Yugoslavia

did.unittitle: File 1. General correspondence on the organization of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary for the settlement of Russian refugees in Yugoslavia
File 2. Personnel applications, certificates, correspondence, lists, and form samples,
Part 5, Curtailment of personnel and the winding up of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary,
Part 6, Duties performed by S. N. Paleolog,
Part 7, Appraisement of S. N. Paleolog's work, and of refugee organizations and separate individuals,
Part 8, Reorganization of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary and criticism of it by the radical émigré press,
File 3. Military assistant to the Government Plenipotentiary, finance representative and representative of state control,
File 4. Committee for the Aid to Russian Refugees, correspondence, Parts 1-2,
File 5. Congress of the representatives of the refugee organizations, July 1920, Bureau of the Congresses, and refugee council 1920-1922
File 6. Russian Ambassador in Belgrade, Parts 1-2,
File 7. Russian Military Attaché in Yugoslavia,
File 8. Russian Red Cross Society in Yugoslavia, Parts 1-2,
File 9. All-Russian Zemstvo Union in Yugoslavia,
File 10. Joint Committee of the Russian Red Cross Society, All-Russian Zemstvo Union, the All-Russian Union of Township, and All-Russian Union of Township in Yugoslavia,
File 15. Book of Reference--lists of colonies and other institutions,
File 16. Department of Labor of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary,
Part 2. Finding of work for refugees,
Part 3. Finding of work for refugees,
Part 1. Settlement on land and cooperatives,
Distribution of clothing and food to the refugees,
File 20. Donation for poor refugees and refugees evacuated from the Crimea,
File 21. The White Cross, the League of Nations, and the American Red Cross--help to the starving people in Russia,
File 22. The search for refugees and lost baggage,
Part 1, Office correspondence of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary,
Parts 2-4, Letters addressed to S. N. Paleolog,
File 25. Department of Education of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary,
Part 1, Advisor for educational affairs in the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary and the Russian-Serbian Gymnasium in Belgrade,
Part 2, Proceedings of the Academic Council attached to the Government commission,
Part 1, The Russian Army and the Commander in Chief, 1920-1925
Part 2, Russian Officers' Association in Yugoslavia,
File 27. Russian associations and unions in Yugoslavia,
File 28. Relations with the Serbian government,
Part 4, Government commission on Russian refugees,
Part 6, Searches of Russians and misunderstandings with the Serbs,
File 29. Disciplinary Courts, Honor Courts, Courts of Referees,
Part 4, Presentation of Russian Orders of Merits to foreigners for assistance rendered to Russian refugees,
Part 1, Proceedings of the conference for the affairs of Russian refugees, 1920
Parts 2-5, Proceedings of the committee to render assistance to Russian refugees in Yugoslavia, nos. 1-99, inclusive,
Part 1, Reports by the Government Plenipotentiary on the conditions of settlement and life of the Russian refugees in Yugoslavia,

Part 2, Report on the settlement of Russian refugees in Yugoslavia and on the activity of the Board of the Government Plenipotentiary from the beginning of evacuation to February 20, 1922, with the attached reports by the representatives of the Government Plenipotentiary: A. A. Khvostov, S. V. Iur'ev, A. A. Dabovskii, and P. S. Lopukhin,
Part 3, Report by the Government Plenipotentiary on the activity of the board from the beginning of evacuation to March, 1922, with materials attached,

Part 4, Reports of the Government Plenipotentiary on the appeal to the League of Nations concerning the settlement of Russian refugees in Yugoslavia, on the existing situation, the care of Russian refugees, etc.,
Part 5, Reports of the boards of Russian colonies in Yugoslavia,
Part 6, Reports on the reception of Russian refugees evacuated from the Crimea to Boka Cattaro by the representative of the Government Plenipotentiary V. F. Romanov,
Part 7, Report on the reception and settlement of Russian refugees in Bosnia and Dalmatia by the representative of the Government Plenipotentiary A. A. Leman,
Part 8, Appendix to A. A. Leman's report,
Part 9, Report by the representative of the Government Plenipotentiary in Croatia and Slavonia P. M. Boiarskii (in duplicate),
Part 10, Travelling notes by the French Major Buxensuse,
Part 11, Travelling notes by a journalist Gleb Alekseev,
File 33. Reception and settlement of refugees coming from North Russia (Former Army of General Yudenich) and report by D. S. Tverskoi in charge of evacuation from the Black Sea Ports,
File 34. The closing down of the office of the Government Plenipotentiary in Boka Cattaro,
File 35. Concerning the handling by P. A. Korbe of money and valuables brought by the former Chief of the Investigation Department in Sebastopol P. Sychev,
File 36. Business correspondence of the representative of the Government Plenipotentiary A. A. Leman,
Part 2, Business correspondence on the organization and settlement of the refugees, Nié region,
Part 4, Business correspondence, representation of the Government Plenipotentiary in Dalmatia. Includes orders and announcements,
Business correspondence with the representative in Dalmatia,
File 37. Business correspondence of the representative of the Government Plenipotentiary, P. M. Boiarskii,
Part 1, Business correspondence with the representative of P. M. Boiarskii in Croatia and Slovenia,
Part 2, Business correspondence of the representative of P. M. Boiarskii in Dalmatia,
File 48. Public chest dedicated to the memory of Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich "Special Fund for the Salvation of Motherland"
Parts 1-6, correspondence concerning collection of donations to the "Fund for the Salvation of Motherland,"
Part 7, correspondence regarding "Fund for the Salvation of Motherland" with the representative in the Far East J. A. Gleboff (I. A. Glebov),

File 49. Russian public chest for liberation (of Russia) dedicated to the memory of the Tsar-the Martyr, Nicholas II, Russkaia Osvoboditel'naia Kazna v Pamiat' Tsaria-Muchenika Nikolaia II-go, ("R.O.K."),
Part 1, Correspondence on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." in Yugoslavia,
Part 2, Correspondence on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." in Bulgaria, Greece, Turkey, and Rumania,
Part 3, Correspondence on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." in Poland, Czechoslovakia, Finland, and Estonia,
Part 4, Correspondence on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." in Western Europe,
Part 5, Correspondence on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." in Egypt, Morocco, Palestine, Syria, and Tunis,
Part 6, Correspondence on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." in North and South America, Japan, Sumatra and Java,
Part 7, Reports on the collection of contributions to the "R.O.K." from May 1, 1930 to May 1, 1932 with some literature re Bratstvo Russkoi Pravdy,
File 50. Government Plenipotentiary for the settlement of Russian refugees in Yugoslavia, G. E. Bozhinskii-Bozhko--liquidation of the office of the Government Plenipotentiary,
